Docs.summary: Renders a list of items as either a static display or an interactive list. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see Mobile Apps & Sites with ASP.NET.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This control supports templated rendering by using device template sets and internal pagination. For more information, see [Device Filtering Overview](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/bdfeaa58-dedd-4c0d-8610-988aac0eff19) and [Pagination](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/b4f4c4bc-226b-46ec-ae46-00497a32f4f2).
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how an array binds and fills a <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.List>. Notice that you can programmatically set the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.List.DataTextField%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.List.DataValueField%2A> properties of the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.List> object.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This property is only used if the value of the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.List.DataSource%2A> property is of type <xref:System.ComponentModel.IListSource>, rather than of type <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerable>.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the data source of the list that is being bound. The default value is . This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see Mobile Apps & Sites with ASP.NET.
Docs.value: The data source of the list that is being bound.

remarks.format: ## Remarks To bind a data source to a list, you must first use the control's <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.DataBind%2A> method to ensure data binding. The data source can either be of type <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerable>, or it can be of type <xref:System.ComponentModel.IListSource>. If the data source is of type <xref:System.ComponentModel.IListSource>, you can use the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.List.DataMember%2A> field to specify which member to extract.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::Web::UI::MobileControls::ListDecoration Decoration { System::Web::UI::MobileControls::ListDecoration get(); void set(System::Web::UI::MobileControls::ListDecoration value); };

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the type of decoration used for items. The default value is . This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see Mobile Apps & Sites with ASP.NET.
Docs.value: An enumerated value representing the type of decoration used for items.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Where the target device permits, list items can be undecorated, or decorated with bullets or numbers. The <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ListDecoration> enumeration has the following values:
|Name|Description| |----------|-----------------| |<xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ListDecoration.None>|No decoration.| |<xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ListDecoration.Bulleted>|List items are decorated with a bullet.| |<xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ListDecoration.Numbered>|List items are decorated with a number.|
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.List.Decoration%2A> property to change the list to a numbered list. The property is set in the last line of the `Page_Load` method. This example is part of a larger example for the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.List> overview.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Custom Event ItemCommand As ListCommandEventHandler

Docs.summary: Occurs when the user selects a command that is associated with a control. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see Mobile Apps & Sites with ASP.NET.

remarks.format:
## Remarks When you render a list by using templates, the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.List.ItemCommand> event handler is called through the event-bubbling mechanism of ASP.NET. The event handler is passed an argument of type <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ListCommandEventArgs>, which contains information about the source item and the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Command.CommandName%2A> property of the control that generated the event. This allows you to render a single list item with multiple associated interactions.
On default rendering, the control provides a basic user interface (UI) that allows the user to click list items. On postback, the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.List.ItemCommand> event handler is called with an argument of type <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ListCommandEventArgs>, which contains information about the source item. The <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Command.CommandName%2A> property of this object is `null`.
## Examples The following code example shows how to use the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.List.ItemCommand> event to call a method that changes the status of an item in the list and recalculates the status totals. This example is part of a larger example for the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.List> overview.
[!code-csharp[MobileListSample#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/MobileListSample/cs/Default.aspx#2)] [!code-vb[MobileListSample#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/MobileListSample/vb/Default.aspx#2)]

MemberSignature.Value: Public Custom Event ItemDataBind As ListDataBindEventHandler

Docs.summary: Occurs when an item in a is bound to data. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see Mobile Apps & Sites with ASP.NET.

remarks.format:
## Remarks When an item in a <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.List> is created and data-bound, this event handler sets the properties of the list item from arbitrary expressions. An item in a <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.List> is of type <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileListItem>. This event is raised as each data source item is bound. This is the best time to filter or group items in the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileListItemCollection> collection, by using the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileListItem.Text%2A> or <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileListItem.Value%2A> Property.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.List.ItemDataBind> event to get the starting totals of status settings for the list. This code is part of a larger example for the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.List> overview.
[!code-csharp[MobileListSample#4](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/MobileListSample/cs/Default.aspx#4)] [!code-vb[MobileListSample#4](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/MobileListSample/vb/Default.aspx#4)]

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Items As MobileListItemCollection

Docs.summary: Returns the collection of items in a list. The default value is an empty collection. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see Mobile Apps & Sites with ASP.NET.
Docs.value: The collection of items in the list.

remarks.format: ## Remarks You can add or remove items from a <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.List> collection by using the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileListItemCollection.Add%2A>, <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileListItemCollection.Remove%2A>, and <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileListItemCollection.RemoveAt%2A> methods of the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileListItemCollection> class.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool ItemsAsLinks { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Docs.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the items in the list are to be treated as hyperlinks. The default value is . This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see Mobile Apps & Sites with ASP.NET.
Docs.value: if items in the list are to be treated as hyperlinks; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks If the value of this property is `true`, the value of the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.List.DataTextField%2A> property is used to display the text of the hyperlink, and the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.List.DataValueField%2A> property is used to specify the target URL. Command events will not be generated for these links. Thus, when the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.List.ItemsAsLinks%2A> property is set to `true`, an <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.List.OnItemCommand%2A> method will not be called because a new page will be loaded through an HTTP call.
